transportAdvice: Dallas is a car-centric city where walking between attractions is generally impractical due to sprawling distances; a light rail and bus network exists but has limited coverage of tourist areas, so renting a car or using taxis is the most practical option for most visitors.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally cold with mild rain; light layers and a jacket are recommended.

Spring arrives with pleasant warmth, though thunderstorms can develop later in the month.

Hot and humid with a high chance of heavy thunderstorms; severe weather is possible.
Very hot and mostly dry; outdoor activities are best planned for early morning or evening.
Peak summer heat with intense sun and little rain; stay hydrated and seek air conditioning.
Equally hot as July with prolonged dry spells; heat advisories are common.
Temperatures begin to ease slightly and occasional rain returns, offering some relief from summer heat.
